front.title: RDAP Extension for DNS Time-To-Live (TTL Values)

abstract.t: This document describes an extension to the Registration Data Access Protocol () which allows the Time-To-Live (TTL) values for relevant DNS record types to be included in RDAP responses.

note.title: About this draft
note.t: The source for this draft, and an issue tracker, may can be found at .

section.name: Introduction
section.t: While allows RDAP server operators to provide information about the content of the NS, DS, A and AAAA record(s) which are published in the DNS for a given registry object (domain or host object), it does not provide a mechanism to allow the Time-To-Live (TTL) values of those records to be included in responses.
This document describes how TTL information can be included in domain and nameserver objects in RDAP responses.

This document is complementary to the Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP) Mapping for DNS Time-to-Live (TTL) Values, but registry operators do not need to implement that extension in their EPP server in order to implement this RDAP extension.

section.name: Conventions used in this document
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.name: RDAP Response Specification
section.t: Servers which support this extension MAY include a ttl0_data property in any domain and nameserver objects included in RDAP responses.
The ttl0_data property is an array of TTL objects, which have the following properties:

ul.li: A types property, which is an array of DNS record type mnemonics;
A value property, which is an unsigned integer indicated the TTL value for those DNS record types;
An OPTIONAL remarks property, which is an array of remarks (see ); and
An OPTIONAL events property, which is an array of events (see ).

section.t: DNS record type mnemonics MUST be in all capitals. Each DNS record type MUST only appear once in each TTL object.
TTL values MUST be unsigned integers in the range 0-2,147,483,647.

section.name: RDAP Conformance
section.t: Servers returning responses containing TTL values MUST include the string "ttl0" in the rdapConformance array.

section.name: IANA Considerations
section.t: IANA is requested to register the following value in the RDAP Extensions Registry:
Intended usage: this extension describes how DNS TTL values can be included in RDAP responses.

section.name: Security Considerations
section.t: Security services for the extension specified in this document are described in .
This document only concerns itself with the representation of configure TTL values for domain and host objects. The security implications of those values are described further in .

ol.li: Updated the extension identifier and extension property name to align with the current best practices in .
Changed MUST to MAY in the first paragraph of .
Reduce ambiguity around the repetition of DNS record types in responses.
Update reference to the EPP extension.
Extension property name renamed to ttl.
The extension data structure is now an array allowing common TTL values, remarks and events to be mapped to multiple DNS record types.
The extension data structure may now include remarks and events.
Added normative text regarding the value of DNS record mnemonics and TTL values.
